intro: Pitardella poilanei, commonly known as the New Zealand pitardella, is a rare and unique species of sea slug found in the coastal waters of New Zealand. It belongs to the family of nudibranchs, which are brightly colored, free-living gastropod mollusks. The species is characterized by its striking coloration, often featuring vivid orange and yellow patterns along its body. It primarily inhabits rocky shores and is known for its specialized feeding habits, mainly consuming algae. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pitardella poilanei is considered a vulnerable species.
